objnote.p: The oval collection stamp (not shown) of John Deffett Francis, "J.D.F.," appears below the design, partly cut off by the edge of the leaf. A pencil sketch of Anubis is on the verso of this water color.

illustration.illusobjdesc: In a forest or other wooded area, two figures kneel in a clearing to warm themselves by a fire. The figure at left is a bearded man with long, curly hair. He appears to be almost entirely nude, with a belt or other object wrapped around his waist and slight suggestion of tights or a transparent, draping cloth over his knees and around his right ankle. The man faces right, kneeling with his knees bent sharply and his buttocks nearly resting on the heels of his flexed feet. His upper body hunches forward as he reaches toward the fire with is prominent right arm. His left arm is hidden, either alongside his right arm or at his left side. The man looks toward the right side of the design and may stare at something just above the fire. His eyes express fear or dread. To the right of this man kneels his companion, a partly nude woman with her long hair gathered into a bun. She is nude from the waist up, but her lower body may be covered by a transparent skirt or other drapery. Her body faces forward and to the right as she kneels with her knees together, but she twists to look back over her right shoulder, toward the left side of the design. Her prominent breasts are notably asymmetrical. Her left arm reaches toward the fire at right, her extended hand hovering over the flames. The position of her right arm is unclear, but it may rest along her side with her hand in her lap. At right of this pair, another figure may hide behind one of the trees and wrap an arm around another. There is only slight suggestion of a head and shoulders. Alternatively, this may not be a figure but only odd wisps of smoke or fire. In the lower righthand corner of the design, a fire blazes over a pile of sticks or wood. It reaches as high as the shoulders of the two figures who warms themselves by it. Red and gray coloring suggest flames and smoke. Below the fire and the two kneeling figures, blue-green coloring indicates grass. Immediately behind the figures and flame are five(?) tall trees, most of which do not have branches. The tree nearest the design's left border leans left from behind the next tree, which rises straight upward behind the kneeling man. From between the heads of the two kneeling figures rises a third tree, much narrower than the first two. Above the woman's outstretched arm rises a fourth tree; it bears a small branch growing upward at 135 degrees from the tree's left side. Finally, a fifth tree leans right toward the right border. This tree may support the third figure. Behind the trees, in the design's background, are rolling hills covered in grass. Above them, alternating blue and white coloring suggests mountains, or perhaps clouds against a dark sky. Shadowy areas are visible underneath the knees of the kneeling man and between the two main figures.
